str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To lie, recline, be placed, be laid, set, specially appointed, destined. Middle voice of a primary verb; to lie outstretched.
Square, four-cornered. From tessares and gonia; four-cornered, i.e. Square.
And, even, also, namely.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Breadth. From platus; width.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: How much, how great, how many, as great as, as much. By reduplication from hos; as As.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Length. Probably akin to megas; length length.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To measure (out), estimate. From metron; to measure; by implication, to admeasure.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A city, the inhabitants of a city. Probably from the same as polemos, or perhaps from polus; a town.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A reed; a reed-pen, reed-staff, measuring rod. Or uncertain affinity; a reed; by implication, a pen.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Equal, equivalent, identical. Probably from eido; similar.
Twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to. From duo and deka; two and ten, i.e. A dozen.
Or masculine stadios from the base of histemi; a stade or certain measure of distance; by implication, a stadium or race-course.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Length. Probably akin to megas; length length.
And, even, also, namely.
Breadth. From platus; width.
And, even, also, namely.
Height, heaven; dignity, eminence. From a derivative of huper; elevation, i.e. altitude, the sky, or dignity.
